subject: Re: [junit] Some questions about JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Yes. That really needs to be configurable. Either that or the machine needs to read my mind. ... Absolutely. The question was, Do I need them and clearly
messageBody:
>So said Vladimir R. Bossicard on 4/14/2003 --------------------
>>>4. Do you use the JUnit addons? How likely is it that we will need
>>>them?
>>
>> You don't need them, but it's good to know what Vladimir offers, in case
>you'd rather use someone else's code over building your own.
>
>If you've been beaten by "expected <......> but was <... ...>" I bet you
>will :-)

Yes. That really needs to be configurable. Either that or the machine needs to read my mind.

>Writing tests is like writing code: everyone has his own recipe. There
>are things I feel are missing from JUnit that's why I ended up with
>JUnit-addons. But anyone is free to not use it :-)

Absolutely. The question was, "Do I need them" and clearly he doesn't. I don't use them (yet) and I get along just fine. [Of course, I understand that my life will improve tremendously once I start using them.]

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
